entry.title: Great for note taking...
entry.content: I use Notability primarily for taking notes with Pencil. Its multitude features sets it far ahead of Apple's Notes app and other note taking apps I have tried. Since I baught it a few years ago it has been worth the cost, especially with the recent update allowing for nested dividers. Only recently I have baught the Math Conversion feature. It has worked very well in the app but you can also paste it as an equation into Pages, which I use as my primary word processor. Buying Notability and the Math Conversion feature solely for this feature can be cheaper than some other alternatives. Since Notability will now become a subscription app, I'm glad they have allowed users who have previously baught the app, to continue without additional cost. This alone could have been the difference between an one or five star review.

Great for note taking...

I use Notability primarily for taking notes with Pencil. Its multitude features sets it far ahead of Apple's Notes app and other note taking apps I have tried. Since I baught it a few years ago it has been worth the cost, especially with the recent update allowing for nested dividers. Only recently I have baught the Math Conversion feature. It has worked very well in the app but you can also paste it as an equation into Pages, which I use as my primary word processor. Buying Notability and the Math Conversion feature solely for this feature can be cheaper than some other alternatives. Since Notability will now become a subscription app, I'm glad they have allowed users who have previously baught the app, to continue without additional cost. This alone could have been the difference between an one or five star review.

entry.title: New Update not backing up
entry.content: I love Notability and have been using it since 2013 - 8 years now! But this new update immediately checked the do not auto backup. And when I am clicking the platform - Google Drive - as my destination for auto backup, nothing is happening and the do not auto back up is still checked and won’t get removed from it. How can this be fixed???

New Update not backing up

And when I am clicking the platform - Google Drive - as my destination for auto backup, nothing is happening and the do not auto back up is still checked and won’t get removed from it. How can this be fixed???

entry.title: Goodbye Notability - It was good while it lasted
entry.content:
I left a very poor one-star review earlier due to the Notability’s elimination of some features that I had already paid for (namely iCloud Sync and Unlimited Editing).
Ginger Labs was in the process of converting their software from as purchased model into a rental model which means you’ll have to pay for it (and a very high price) annually for the rest of your life.
Given that I was unwilling to rent something that I already owned, I was unable to use the product for several days while Ginger Labs worked this out. Many folks said this was a violation of the App Store TOS but I can’t confirm that myself.
I agree in supporting developers 100 % because I have been a developer for more that 40 years. However, renting software with a recurring fee is the worst way to do this. I despise the rental model and especially the way Ginger Labs implemented it.
Forcing a rental payment tells me as a developer that you may not have the confidence necessary to continue offering features in the future worth purchasing as add-ons and that's very troubling.
Ginger Labs took a minor step but did address the issue for legacy purchasers (for now) so I’m giving them back a well-deserved 3 stars because the product is quite good. I would have given them 5 stars have they not converted to rental.
However, given that they’ve embraced the rental model, I cannot in good conscience continue using this product anymore (except in the most basic of situations). I believe that eventually they will force me to start paying rental fees for the rest of my life and I’m not a heavy enough user to justify this.
Also, given that most of these programs store data in proprietary formats, I don't want to get stuck with lots of documents in Notability that I'll potentially lose if they decide to force me into a rental model again several years from now.
Goodbye Notability and I’ll miss you.

Goodbye Notability - It was good while it lasted

I left a very poor one-star review earlier due to the Notability’s elimination of some features that I had already paid for (namely iCloud Sync and Unlimited Editing).

Ginger Labs was in the process of converting their software from as purchased model into a rental model which means you’ll have to pay for it (and a very high price) annually for the rest of your life.

Given that I was unwilling to rent something that I already owned, I was unable to use the product for several days while Ginger Labs worked this out. Many folks said this was a violation of the App Store TOS but I can’t confirm that myself.

I agree in supporting developers 100 % because I have been a developer for more that 40 years. However, renting software with a recurring fee is the worst way to do this. I despise the rental model and especially the way Ginger Labs implemented it.

Forcing a rental payment tells me as a developer that you may not have the confidence necessary to continue offering features in the future worth purchasing as add-ons and that's very troubling.

Ginger Labs took a minor step but did address the issue for legacy purchasers (for now) so I’m giving them back a well-deserved 3 stars because the product is quite good. I would have given them 5 stars have they not converted to rental.

However, given that they’ve embraced the rental model, I cannot in good conscience continue using this product anymore (except in the most basic of situations). I believe that eventually they will force me to start paying rental fees for the rest of my life and I’m not a heavy enough user to justify this.

Also, given that most of these programs store data in proprietary formats, I don't want to get stuck with lots of documents in Notability that I'll potentially lose if they decide to force me into a rental model again several years from now.

Goodbye Notability and I’ll miss you.

entry.title: Subscription Mandatory? Really?
entry.content:
Update: Lifetime features for seniors users. Excellent. Thank you.
—————-
Old comment:
I considered myself as a supportive buyer inside the Apple Community. Instead of buying cracked apps and jailbreaked apps I always support the developers. That’s why I trust your app since day one even with the hiccups. Bought the Desktop, and the mobile apps even when other devs bundle up their apps to run everywhere. I support your in apps purchases and now you want me to pretend tha I never paid for your product and subscribe??? I believe all of us that paid deserve a full feature app as we used to without any monthly payment! You are insulting us your buyers, the ones that put our hard work money in your hand trusting your tool will be of great help. Let the new buyers pay a subscription but leave us alone or name this app ‘legacy’ and let us keep it. You basically are forcing us to delete this app and get another alternative just for the insult. I hope you can still get a float after this bad decision that will get remembered forever. Very disappointed.

Subscription Mandatory? Really?

Update:
Lifetime features for seniors users. Excellent. Thank you.

—————-

Old comment:

I considered myself as a supportive buyer inside the Apple Community. Instead of buying cracked apps and jailbreaked apps I always support the developers. That’s why I trust your app since day one even with the hiccups. Bought the Desktop, and the mobile apps even when other devs bundle up their apps to run everywhere. I support your in apps purchases and now you want me to pretend tha I never paid for your product and subscribe??? I believe all of us that paid deserve a full feature app as we used to without any monthly payment! You are insulting us your buyers, the ones that put our hard work money in your hand trusting your tool will be of great help. Let the new buyers pay a subscription but leave us alone or name this app ‘legacy’ and let us keep it. You basically are forcing us to delete this app and get another alternative just for the insult. I hope you can still get a float after this bad decision that will get remembered forever. Very disappointed.

entry.title: Okay, better with the Apple Pencil some kind of stylus, terrible business decision
entry.content: The update is TERRIBLE when it comes to user-friendliness. The free version has limited functionality and features and lots of necessary features are behind a paywall that not everyone can afford. Granted, I do not have a stylus, but I think that a one-time purchase and then all the features are accessible to everyone wouldn’t just be good for the user but would also bring more people to your app. Also, take my review with a grain of salt. I don’t hate the app and I like the audio recording feature, straight-line feature, text, and more, but the way a great number of features like syncing, unlimited note editing, and templates, etc are locked away behind a pay-wall just doesn't seem like something you would do, but unfortunately it you did.

entry.title: Have Used It For Years
entry.content: I am working through my second masters and head a small non-profit that focuses on social services. I used this app both for study and for business. I also enjoy using to to import articles that I wanted to read and make notes on. I also use it for commenting on projects that my team is working on. I have used it with every generation of the Apple Pencil and it works well. The organization and search functions are easy to get used to. I’ve been enjoying this app for multiple years and prefer it to OneNote and even the native Notes app on iOS.

I have used it with every generation of the Apple Pencil and it works well. The organization and search functions are easy to get used to. I’ve been enjoying this app for multiple years and prefer it to OneNote and even the native Notes app on iOS.

entry.title: Great app, but a bit disappointed
entry.content:
I am happy to see that all of us who purchased the app don’t have to subscribe. What kinda bothers me is the wording used. “We have access to all existing features or items purchased prior 1 Nov” How it’s worded seems to imply any new features or services we may not have access to unless we subscribe. That thought seems a little crappie. If true those who bought the app and want access to new features will end up out of pocket more than some who subscribed on 2 Nov never having to have pay for the app. I really really hope I am wrong, but if correct it’s pretty underhanded.
My rating is not about a app which hands down is epic. My rating is my response to the realization that those who supported this company by buying this product may find themselves forced to pay for a subscription just to have the latest and greatest. Those who paid for the app should have a life time guarantee to all software updates, features, and service updates under same structure we had prior to 1 Nov In my opinion!

entry.title: Lost trust
entry.content:
I’ve been a happy and appreciative Notability user for several years. I have used it for note taking for trainings, lectures and meetings. It has been a valuable tool to stay organized in a critical part of my work. Notability has also contributed to feeling good about going paperless in my personal life. I have shared with my friends how much I appreciated having this app and had often recommended it.
I feel sad for Ginger lab about their initial decision to take away core features from us old and loyal users that we have paid for, and that they would expect that we would pay for them again-as they switched to a subscription model. It sadly says a lot about them that they made a decision to break their TOS agreement with Apple and the agreement they made with us. They placed making money over integrity and ethics. It was only when we spoke up about their abusive behavior in our reviews and in social media, and news organizations picked up the story, did they realize that their plan to make more money had backfired. When the rumbling of a law suit, the demands that monies be retuned, and the very negative reviews all of which would affect their income…It was only then that they change their decision and gave back what they had stolen. And even now, from reading these reviews, it appears that at least one feature is still being kept and not returned.
You have probably heard the story of the scorpion and the fox… The moral of the story being once a scorpion always a scorpion. I can no longer trust that Ginger Labs will not break more agreements and rules in the future for the sake of making more money. I do not want to support in anyway a company that does this. I have already purchased GoodNotes 5 at half price and will be transitioning from Notability. I will share with my friends and coworkers my sadness for Ginger Labs and suggest they purchase GoodNotes instead.
This experience has been a good opportunity to practice holding my attachments lightly, and appreciate Impermanence.

Lost trust

I’ve been a happy and appreciative Notability user for several years. I have used it for note taking for trainings, lectures and meetings. It has been a valuable tool to stay organized in a critical part of my work. Notability has also contributed to feeling good about going paperless in my personal life. I have shared with my friends how much I appreciated having this app and had often recommended it.

I feel sad for Ginger lab about their initial decision to take away core features from us old and loyal users that we have paid for, and that they would expect that we would pay for them again-as they switched to a subscription model. It sadly says a lot about them that they made a decision to break their TOS agreement with Apple and the agreement they made with us. They placed making money over integrity and ethics. It was only when we spoke up about their abusive behavior in our reviews and in social media, and news organizations picked up the story, did they realize that their plan to make more money had backfired. When the rumbling of a law suit, the demands that monies be retuned, and the very negative reviews all of which would affect their income…It was only then that they change their decision and gave back what they had stolen. And even now, from reading these reviews, it appears that at least one feature is still being kept and not returned.

You have probably heard the story of the scorpion and the fox… The moral of the story being once a scorpion always a scorpion. I can no longer trust that Ginger Labs will not break more agreements and rules in the future for the sake of making more money. I do not want to support in anyway a company that does this. I have already purchased GoodNotes 5 at half price and will be transitioning from Notability. I will share with my friends and coworkers my sadness for Ginger Labs and suggest they purchase GoodNotes instead.

This experience has been a good opportunity to practice holding my attachments lightly, and appreciate Impermanence.

entry.title: Poor subscription model.
entry.content:
Locking features that people previously paid for behind a subscription is a tactic that I can't get behind. I would rather see a new major version that requires a subscription and gets new features and updates. That way those of us who already paid can continue to use the features we paid for and not "mooch" future updates. I hate the rental model in general, but I especially hate it when you lose things you already had. I'll be moving all of my notes to a different application, sadly.
Update: The company backpedaled pretty quickly, but my confidence is gone. There have been countless examples of other software going subscription and this company either learned nothing, ignored it, or thought they could be the one that got away with radically undermining their existing customers.
I don’t think we should be applauding them for “doing the right thing” when it’s obvious they want to do the wrong thing, they just weren’t capable of getting away with it. Now they’re trying to salvage trust and goodwill. Unfortunately, my trust isn’t so easily won back.

Poor subscription model.

Locking features that people previously paid for behind a subscription is a tactic that I can't get behind. I would rather see a new major version that requires a subscription and gets new features and updates. That way those of us who already paid can continue to use the features we paid for and not "mooch" future updates. I hate the rental model in general, but I especially hate it when you lose things you already had. I'll be moving all of my notes to a different application, sadly.

Update: The company backpedaled pretty quickly, but my confidence is gone. There have been countless examples of other software going subscription and this company either learned nothing, ignored it, or thought they could be the one that got away with radically undermining their existing customers.

I don’t think we should be applauding them for “doing the right thing” when it’s obvious they want to do the wrong thing, they just weren’t capable of getting away with it. Now they’re trying to salvage trust and goodwill. Unfortunately, my trust isn’t so easily won back.

entry.title: Dissapointed I lost important docs through this app
entry.content: As a medical student, I and my classmates rely on notability for keeping our lectures. WE are very upset with this app. It has gone down in the last two years. 1. There are more technical glitches upon usage. Pdf/powerpoints/files can not be uploaded smoothly. 2. Notability will frequently freeze on you when you are trying to use it. 3. Customer Support is terrible at addressing concerns effectively. I emailed support and they emailed me back weeks later and my issue still has not been resolved. 4. Additionally, technical support is not available also. I have the IPad Pro. This app is not worth the 10 dollars I pay. I’m shopping elsewhere and suggest that you do too.

Dissapointed I lost important docs through this app

Additionally, technical support is not available also. I have the IPad Pro. This app is not worth the 10 dollars I pay. I’m shopping elsewhere and suggest that you do too.

entry.title: Be CAREFUL
entry.content:
I bought Notability and have liked it, but now They’ve switched to a subscription product. I have a lot of data and I have lost trust in App Store developers with their propensity to screw existing customers with this subscription scheme trend. Some things you don’t want to rent, and something that has a lot of personal and sensitive data is one of them.
HOLD OFF buying or upgrading until we see what kind of developer they’ll be…

entry.title: This SaaS everywhere is getting ridiculous
entry.content: Previously they tried to go against Apple TOS by not allowing legacy people to use the features they paid for, but they have rescinded that after much backlash. With the SaaS model being implemented I will no longer recommend friends to use notability. I will continue to use it as I have my notes ecosystem in this app and I can continue to use it, but because everything is going toward SaaS it just is ridiculous a note taking app is going with that trend.

entry.content: Notabililty has all the features that are important to me, pass protections, organization, apple pencil compatible, handwriting to text conversion, just to mention a few. Definitely will continue to be my goto app for note taking for the forseeable future.

Great notaking app, long time user

Notabililty has all the features that are important to me, pass protections, organization, apple pencil compatible, handwriting to text conversion, just to mention a few.
Definitely will continue to be my goto app for note taking for the forseeable future.

entry.title: Dev plans to screw over customers who’ve purchased.
entry.content:
As the title says. The developers of the app are turning this into to a greed-based subscription app. A-la Fantastical.
Any sub services get deleted from my phone. Look. We have enough subscriptions and bills to pay for. We don’t need another just so devs can eat with golden utensils.
One of the quotes from the company was “We can’t have med students graduating for free”.
You guys used to be a good team. But then you turned into this greedy conglomerate of a thing. Shame on you!

entry.title: Get this App!!!!
entry.content: I've used notability for years, starting my sophmore year of college, and I've always loved the features and hated the organization. With the new update, this app is *literally* perfect. For a while I was thinking of switching but I wanted to hold out to see if GingerLabs would update theit app (thank you guys so much). I wish I could have used the hexagon pages in organic chemistry but oh well, I so look forward to continuing to use Notability through my master's degree and hopefully graduate school after that. Get this app, you'll love it!

Get this App!!!!

For a while I was thinking of switching but I wanted to hold out to see if GingerLabs would update theit app (thank you guys so much). I wish I could have used the hexagon pages in organic chemistry but oh well, I so look forward to continuing to use Notability through my master's degree and hopefully graduate school after that. Get this app, you'll love it!

entry.title: Organization Game Changer!
entry.content:
I use this app every day! I have a digital planner that I plan my day, week , month & Year. I love having the info on all of my devices. I also print out the daily page to have it handy.
I am also constantly learning so I take my course notes and organize them in here so I can find them and put the info into practice easily!
One of my favorite apps of all time.

Organization Game Changer!

I use this app every day! I have a digital planner that I plan my day, week , month & Year. I love having the info on all of my devices. I also print out the daily page to have it handy.

I am also constantly learning so I take my course notes and organize them in here so I can find them and put the info into practice easily!

One of my favorite apps of all time.

entry.title: Here since January 2013
entry.content: And I'm here to stay. I download this app in 2013 while in the military because I knew it would come in handy. I've used it off and on up until 2018. Then in last 2018, my car was broken into and my backpack with all of my lab notebooks, textbooks , and lecture notes inside. From then on, I went strictly digital with all my notes and texts. Notability facilitated that transition smoothly for me! Classmates were always asking me for my notes. Professors loved recieving my assignments. Fast forward to the pandemic and now nearly everyone has gone digital. Whenever I see someone get a new iPad I instantly recommend this app! I've downloaded thousands of apps since 2009, but this by far has been the most important download and purchase for me. I will continue to use it throught my medical school studies and well beyond! Thank you Notability and Ginger Labs! I hope youre here to stay.

entry.title: Was Excellent. Please fix!!!!
entry.content: My go to app, for all of my writing and paste up projects. Versatility and features are unsurpassed. Very happy though that you’re remaining loyal to, and keeping your original customers under the original price agreement. “Hello …….. I appreciate the regular updates, but one of the previous updates caused documents to launch in the drawing mode…… This is very annoying, because every time I go to inspect or just read a document I accidentally draw on it… Please return it to the way it was, where documents launch in the mode they were left in. Or create a setting for startup default.

Was Excellent. Please fix!!!!

My go to app, for all of my writing and paste up projects. Versatility and features are unsurpassed. Very happy though that you’re remaining loyal to, and keeping your original customers under the original price agreement. “Hello …….. I appreciate the regular updates, but one of the previous updates caused documents to launch in the drawing mode…… This is very annoying, because every time I go to inspect or just read a document I accidentally draw on it… Please return it to the way it was, where documents launch in the mode they were left in. Or create a setting for startup default.
